title: (x) Hartford Courant daily newspaper - Minion, Nimrod, Poynter Gothic {Jan E, Bob E}
content:
can anybody tell me what fonts they are using on their logo, headlines and body text? are they available for purchase? if no, is there anything similar to those fonts?

cheers

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [hc1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140612011839/http:/typophile.com/files/hc1.jpg) | 80.5 KB |
author: Lirak

comments.content: Headlines are Minion. Couldn’t find my microscope to take a look at the body text. Logo most likely custom.
What Jan says. Most of those newspaper nameplates are custom designed, and a lot of them by [one man](http://web.archive.org/web/20140612011839/http:/www.typedesign.com/logos/acti.html). ;^)

This is the list of all fonts used on the front page:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140612011839im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Hartford_5108.gif)

@bojev: can you tell me what are all of those fonts used for? i'd really like to know it

thnx again

Varies by issue from what I can see (at [http://www.newseum.org/todaysfrontpages/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140612011839/http:/www.newseum.org/todaysfrontpages/ "http://www.newseum.org/todaysfrontpages/"))  
 but - Heads are Minion - Subheads and captions are Poynter - body text is NimrodMT  
Line below masthead is Poynter except for Star which is Hartford Pi  
UPC code is MefcoOcrb  
Most boxed items at bottom of page are Poynter for text sizes with Minion Subheads
